benchmark_details.name: MultiTrust
benchmark_details.overview: MultiTrust is the first comprehensive and unified benchmark to evaluate the trustworthiness of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) across five main aspects: truthfulness, safety, robustness, fairness, and privacy, implementing 32 diverse tasks with self-curated datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation framework for assessing the trustworthiness of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) across various tasks and risks.

data.source: MultiTrust comprises datasets curated from literature, adapted from existing datasets, and newly synthesized data via generative methods and manual collection.
data.annotation: Manually curated and automatically generated samples for accuracy and relevance of tasks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated as per specific tasks mentioned in the evaluations, using different evaluative metrics suited to each task type.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better performance in the respective tasks assessing the MLLMs' trustworthiness and reliability across various aspects.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through extensive systematic evaluations with diverse MLLMs.

targeted_risks.harm: This benchmark aims to address issues related to privacy leaks, bias in AI systems, and overall impact on user trust.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY 4.0 for the datasets constructed from scratch; licensing follows original datasets for adapted samples.
